answers.answer: Hello Dear,You should consult a neurologist and get a comlete neurological examination done to rule out any pathology..Do you have diabetes or hypertension?Get a blood sugar tested and monitor your blood pressure levels.Carpal tunnel syndrome usually does not cause shoulder discomfort.Also you can take some  vitamin B supplements to strengthen your nerves if your physician suggests.Best

No to diabetes, yes to hypertension.  I haven't checked my blood pressure in a couple of months since it was doing really good at the time of my last dr visit.  I will begin monitor it more.  Can high blood pressure cause problesm with nerves?

question: My fingers gradually stayed numb all day and night...both hands and all fingeres.  For the past week, my shoulders have felt "asleep" and takes all day for it to thaw; although they don't completely thaw out.  There is also a twitching above my right eye that is getting really aggrivating.  I've had these off and on for years, but now it seems to want to twitch more than stay still.  I had a nerve conduction test about 3 years ago to help diagonse radial nerve compression and tennis elbow.  At that time, the dr. saw more problems with carpal tunnel than the radial nerve.  Could this cause the discomfort in my shoulders?
title: Tingling fingers/numb shoulders
